value.title: Manage Azure PaaS resources using automated methods
value.excerpt: Explore SQL automation for Azure SQL Database and Open Source databases. Configure elastic jobs and Azure Policy.

value.title: Optimize the performance of Azure Cosmos DB by using partitioning and indexing strategies
value.excerpt: Learn how to measure the throughput of your NoSQL database and assess the impact of partition key and indexing strategies on throughput.

images.title: Optimize the performance of Azure Cosmos DB by using partitioning and indexing strategies

value.title: Persist and retrieve relational data with Entity Framework Core
value.excerpt: Query and manage relational data in a .NET Core app with an Object-Relational Mapper (O/RM).

images.title: Persist and retrieve relational data with Entity Framework Core

value.title: Protect data in-transit and at rest
value.excerpt: Protect data in-transit and at rest

value.title: Schedule tasks using SQL Server Agent
value.excerpt: Explore SQL automation for scheduled tasks and automatic alerts for SQL Server and Managed Instance. Configure extended event sessions for tracing activities.

value.title: Store and Access NoSQL Data with Azure Cosmos DB and the Table API
value.excerpt: Get lower latency, higher availability, and easier scaling by moving your Azure Storage Tables application to Azure Cosmos DB.

images.title: Store and Access NoSQL Data with Azure Cosmos DB and the Table API

value.title: Work with mutable and partial data in Azure Cache for Redis
value.excerpt: Use Azure Cache for Redis to store frequently accessed data. Learn how to create transactions, manage memory, and use the cache-aside pattern.

images.title: Work with mutable and partial data in Azure Cache for Redis

value.title: Build the intelligent edge with Azure IoT Edge
value.excerpt: Interested in building end to end IoT solutions or about Azure IoT, but aren't quite sure what it can do for you? This path is the place to start.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure IoT Edge
topItems.excerpt: Explain the essential characteristics of the IoT Edge and the functionality of the IoT Edge components (modules, runtime, and cloud interface). Characterize the types of problems that you can solve with IoT Edge.  Describe how the elements of IoT Edge can be combined to solve the problem of deploying IoT applications in the cloud.

images.title: Introduction to Azure IoT Edge

topItems.title: Deploy a prebuilt module to the Edge device
topItems.excerpt: Deploy a pre-built temperature simulator module to the edge using a container. The pre-built module will be deployed to an IoT edge device. You will check that the module was successfully created and deployed to the edge. You will view the simulated data from the deployed module.

images.title: Deploy a prebuilt module to the Edge device

topItems.title: Set up an IoT Edge Gateway
topItems.excerpt: This module is theoretical and will walk you through how an IoT Edge device can be used as a gateway.

images.title: Set up an IoT Edge Gateway
Introduction to Azure IoT Edge

value.title: Migrate an ASP.NET web application to Azure App Service
value.excerpt: Migrate an ASP.NET web application to Azure App Service

topItems.title: Externalize configuration for your ASP.NET application using Azure Key Vault
topItems.excerpt: Learn how use ConfigurationBuilder to dynamically configure an ASP.NET web application to retrieve secrets from Azure Key vault

topItems.title: Implement logging in a .NET Framework ASP.NET web application
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to implement logging in an ASP.NET web application, to store log data in Azure blob storage, and incorporate log information in Application Insights performance data.

topItems.title: Improve session scalability in a .NET Framework ASP.NET web application using Azure Cache for Redis
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use Azure Cache for Redis to store session data and improve the scalability of web applications

value.title: Migrate an ASP.NET web application to Azure with Visual Studio
value.excerpt: Migrate an ASP.NET web application to Azure with Visual Studio

topItems.title: Externalize configuration for your ASP.NET application using Azure Key Vault
topItems.excerpt: Learn how use ConfigurationBuilder to dynamically configure an ASP.NET web application to retrieve secrets from Azure Key vault

topItems.title: Implement logging in a .NET Framework ASP.NET web application
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to implement logging in an ASP.NET web application, to store log data in Azure blob storage, and incorporate log information in Application Insights performance data.

topItems.title: Improve session scalability in a .NET Framework ASP.NET web application using Azure Cache for Redis
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use Azure Cache for Redis to store session data and improve the scalability of web applications

value.title: Migrate SQL workloads to Azure
value.excerpt: The objective of this learning path is to educate the learner how they can migrate SQL Server workloads to SQL Services that exist on Azure.

topItems.title: Migrate SQL workloads to Azure virtual machines
topItems.excerpt: Learners will be able to demonstrate the benefits and processes for moving a SQL Server database to an Azure virtual machine.

images.title: Migrate SQL workloads to Azure virtual machines

topItems.title: Migrate SQL Workloads to Azure SQL Databases
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you will learn to demonstrate the benefits and processes for moving a SQL Server database to Azure SQL Database.

images.title: Migrate SQL Workloads to Azure SQL Databases

topItems.title: Migrate SQL Workloads to Azure Managed Instances
topItems.excerpt: Learners will be able to demonstrate the benefits and processes for moving a SQL Server database to an Azure SQL Database Managed Instance.

images.title: Migrate SQL Workloads to Azure Managed Instances
Migrate SQL workloads to Azure virtual machines

value.title: Migrating Cassandra and MongoDB workloads to Cosmos DB
value.excerpt: This learning path enables students to migrate Cassandra and MongoDB workloads to Cosmos DB.

topItems.title: Introduction to open source database migration to Azure Cosmos DB
topItems.excerpt: In this module, the learner will gain an understanding of Cosmos DB and the main considerations when migrating to Cosmos DB.

images.title: Introduction to open source database migration to Azure Cosmos DB

topItems.title: Migrate Cassandra workloads to Cosmos DB
topItems.excerpt: Learners will be able to demonstrate the benefits and processes for moving a Cassandra database to the Azure Cosmos DB Cassandra API.

images.title: Migrate Cassandra workloads to Cosmos DB

topItems.title: Migrate on-premises MongoDB databases to Cosmos DB
topItems.excerpt: Learners will be able to demonstrate the benefits and processes for moving a MongoDB database to the Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB API.

images.title: Migrate on-premises MongoDB databases to Cosmos DB
Introduction to open source database migration to Azure Cosmos DB

value.title: Optimize query performance in SQL Server
value.excerpt: Analyze individual query performance and determine where improvements can be made. Explore performance-related Dynamic Management Objects. Investigate how indexes and database design affect queries.

topItems.title: Describe SQL Server query plans
topItems.excerpt: Read and understand various forms of execution plans. Compare estimated vs actual plans. Learn how and why plans are generated.

topItems.title: Evaluate performance improvements
topItems.excerpt: Evaluate possible changes to indexes. Determine the impact of changes to queries and indexes. Explore relevant Dynamic Management Objects.

topItems.title: Explore performance-based design
topItems.excerpt: Evaluate possible changes to indexes. Determine the impact of changes to queries and indexes. Explore relevant Dynamic Management Objects.

value.title: Plan and implement a high availability and disaster recovery environment
value.excerpt: Data must be available when needed. Configure, test and manage a solution for high availability and disaster recovery using Azure tools and SQL Server tools.

topItems.title: Describe high availability and disaster recovery strategies
topItems.excerpt: Plan appropriate HA/DR strategy based on RTO and RPO. Choose best solution for IaaS or PaaS deployments or hybrid workloads.

topItems.title: Explore IaaS and PaaS platform tools for high availability and disaster recovery
topItems.excerpt: Deploy Windows Server Failover Cluster and AGs in Azure and hybrid environments. Configure temporal tables, geo-replication and auto failover groups.

topItems.title: Back up and restore databases
topItems.excerpt: Plan and implement policy for recovering data in case of user error or failure of technology. Explore various options for how and where to backup and restore databases.

value.title: See Azure in action
value.excerpt: Many organizations are eager to take advantage of the benefits of cloud computing by migrating their existing apps and workloads to the cloud from their on-premises datacenters. The competitive advantages of higher efficiency, greater flexibility, lower costs, and better performance are appealing, but getting started can feel intimidating. To help you get started with migration, the demos in this module provide an opportunity to see Azure in action.

images.title: See Azure in action

value.title: Back up and restore databases
value.excerpt: Plan and implement policy for recovering data in case of user error or failure of technology. Explore various options for how and where to backup and restore databases.

value.title: Build a Node.js app for Azure Cosmos DB in Visual Studio Code
value.excerpt: Build a database app to store and query data in Azure Cosmos DB by using Visual Studio Code and Node.js.

images.title: Build a Node.js app for Azure Cosmos DB in Visual Studio Code

value.title: Configure automatic deployment for Azure SQL Database
value.excerpt: Utilize Azure Resource Manager templates for deploying Azure SQL resources.

value.title: Configure databases for performance
value.excerpt: Control database-level configuration options. Explore Intelligent Query Processing. Configure Open Source databases for optimum performance.

value.title: Configure SQL Server resources for optimal performance
value.excerpt: Choose the appropriate size and storage options for your Azure SQL databases. Configure server resources such as tempdb. Understand the usage of Resource Governor.

value.title: Describe high availability and disaster recovery strategies
value.excerpt: Plan appropriate HA/DR strategy based on RTO and RPO. Choose best solution for IaaS or PaaS deployments or hybrid workloads.

value.title: Describe performance-related maintenance tasks in SQL Server
value.excerpt: Implement tasks for both IaaS and PaaS to maintain indexes, and statistics. Explore the automatic tuning features of Azure SQL Database.

value.title: Describe SQL Server query plans
value.excerpt: Read and understand various forms of execution plans. Compare estimated vs actual plans. Learn how and why plans are generated.

value.title: Design for availability and recoverability in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to handle infrastructure and service failure, recover from the loss if data, and recover from a disaster by designing availability and recoverability into your architecture.

images.title: Design for availability and recoverability in Azure
Design for availability and recoverability in Azure

value.title: Design for performance and scalability in Azure
value.excerpt: Scaling your system to handle load, identifying network bottlenecks, and optimizing your storage performance are important to ensure your users have the best experience. Learn how to make your application perform at its best.

images.title: Design for performance and scalability in Azure
Design for performance and scalability in Azure

value.title: Explore IaaS and PaaS platform tools for high availability and disaster recovery
value.excerpt: Deploy Windows Server Failover Cluster and AGs in Azure and hybrid environments. Configure temporal tables, geo-replication and auto failover groups.

value.title: Explore performance-based design
value.excerpt: Evaluate possible changes to indexes. Determine the impact of changes to queries and indexes. Explore relevant Dynamic Management Objects.

value.title: Migrate Cassandra workloads to Cosmos DB
value.excerpt: Learners will be able to demonstrate the benefits and processes for moving a Cassandra database to the Azure Cosmos DB Cassandra API.

images.title: Migrate Cassandra workloads to Cosmos DB

value.title: Migrate on-premises MongoDB databases to Cosmos DB
value.excerpt: Learners will be able to demonstrate the benefits and processes for moving a MongoDB database to the Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB API.

images.title: Migrate on-premises MongoDB databases to Cosmos DB

value.title: Migrate on-premises MySQL databases to Azure Database for MySQL
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn about the benefits of migrating MySQL workloads to Azure, you'll see how to create an Azure Database for MySQL instance, and learn how to migrate on-premises MySQL databases to Azure.

images.title: Migrate on-premises MySQL databases to Azure Database for MySQL
